references.paper_title: Finite-time last-iterate convergence for learning in multi-player games
references.reason: This paper establishes the last-iterate convergence rate of Optimistic Gradient Descent-Ascent (OGDA), providing a benchmark for comparison with the OFTRL algorithms analyzed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Last-iterate convergence: Zero-sum games and constrained min-max optimization
references.reason: This paper investigates the last-iterate convergence properties of OGDA in zero-sum games, which is directly relevant to the study of last-iterate convergence in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Tight last-iterate convergence rates for no-regret learning in multi-player games
references.reason: This paper provides tight last-iterate convergence rates for no-regret learning in multi-player games, offering a theoretical foundation for understanding the convergence behavior of the algorithms studied in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Faster game solving via predictive Blackwell approachability: Connecting regret matching and mirror descent
references.reason: This paper connects regret matching and mirror descent algorithms, providing insights into the relationship between different online learning methods and their convergence properties, directly relevant to the algorithms considered in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Fast convergence of regularized learning in games
references.reason: This paper provides results on the fast convergence of regularized learning in games which are fundamental to the analysis of the convergence behavior of optimistic algorithms presented in the main paper.
